dcterms:description: Dex-Net 2.0 is a large-scale simulated dataset for parallel-gripper grasping, containing 6.7 million grasps on pre-rendered depth images of 3D models. The grasp labels were acquired via random sampling of antipodal grasp candidates, with a heuristic-based approach used to compute a robustness metric.
dcterms:title: Dex-Net 2.0

dcterms:creator: L. Jiang
S. Moseson
A. Saxena
dcterms:description: The Cornell Grasping Dataset (CGD) contains manually-labeled grasp annotations for RGBD images, providing a more comprehensive grasping representation compared to Dex-Net 2.0.
dcterms:title: Cornell Grasping Dataset (CGD)

dcterms:creator: A. Depierre
E. DellandrÂ´ea
L. Chen
dcterms:description: The Jacquard Dataset is a large-scale dataset for robotic grasp detection, providing a variety of grasp annotations for testing grasping algorithms.
dcterms:title: Jacquard Dataset
